title: Hans Nowak
text:
Hans Nowak (9 August 1937 – 19 July 2012) was a German <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. He played in four matches at the <a href="1962%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1962 FIFA World Cup</a>.
Club career.
Nowak was born in <a href="Gelsenkirchen">Gelsenkirchen</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>. While playing for <a href="FC%20Bayern%20Munich">FC Bayern Munich</a>, he won the <a href="UEFA%20Cup%20Winners%27%20Cup">Cup Winners' Cup</a> in <a href="1966%E2%80%9367%20European%20Cup%20Winners%27%20Cup">1967</a>.
International career.
Nowak became notable for being the first attacking <a href="Fullback%20%28association%20football%29">full-back</a> in German football. Between September 1961 and November 1964, Nowak was the standard <a href="Fullback%20%28association%20football%29">right back</a> of <a href="Germany%20national%20football%20team">West Germany</a>, starting in 15 out of 20 international games during that period. He didn't score during this period.
Career after pro times.
After retiring in 1971, Nowak coached FC Hochstadt and <a href="FC%20Herzogenaurach">FC Herzogenaurach</a>. He later worked for <a href="Puma%20AG">Puma AG</a> in <a href="Herzogenaurach">Herzogenaurach</a>, becoming director of public relations there. After leaving <a href="Puma%20AG">Puma AG</a> in 1991, he worked for <a href="FC%20Bayern%20Munich">FC Bayern Munich</a>, organising the sales of merchandising.
